title: 115_s1742
content: The "Medicare at 55 Act" allows individuals aged 55 to 64 to buy into Medicare. This Act adds a new section to the Social Security Act for this purpose. The "Medicare at 55 Act" allows individuals aged 55 to 64 to enroll in Medicare, providing them with the same benefits as those entitled to parts A, B, and D, including the option to enroll in a Medicare Advantage plan with prescription drug coverage. Eligibility requirements include being a U.S. resident, a citizen, national, or lawful permanent resident, and not being entitled to Medicare otherwise. The "Medicare at 55 Act" allows individuals aged 55 to 64 to enroll in Medicare, providing them with the same benefits as those entitled to parts A, B, and D. Eligibility requirements include being a U.S. resident, citizen, national, or lawful permanent resident, and not being entitled to Medicare otherwise. The Secretary will establish enrollment periods and coverage, with coverage starting on January 1, 2019. Monthly premiums will be determined annually for enrolled individuals. The annual premium for coverage under the "Medicare at 55 Act" is calculated based on the average per capita amount for benefits and expenses payable under parts A, B, and D. Individuals can choose Medicare Advantage or prescription drug plans with additional premiums. The Medicare at 55 Act allows individuals to choose Medicare Advantage or prescription drug plans with additional premiums. Premiums for enrollment must be paid to the Secretary as determined. Amounts collected are deposited in the Federal Trust Funds. Enrollees are not eligible for Medicare cost-sharing assistance. The Medicare at 55 Act allows individuals to choose Medicare Advantage or prescription drug plans with additional premiums. Premiums for enrollment must be paid to the Secretary as determined. Coverage provided under this section constitutes minimum essential coverage for purposes of the Affordable Care Act. The Secretary determines the second lowest cost silver plan for coverage under this section. Eligibility for cost-sharing subsidies is based on coverage under a qualified health plan in the silver level offered through an Exchange. Guaranteed issue of Medigap policies upon enrollment under this section, with age requirement substituted to 55. The provisions of this section regarding enrollment and reenrollment apply when an individual attains 55 years of age and disenrolls, ensuring no effect on benefits for individuals otherwise eligible or on trust funds. The Secretary consults with various parties when implementing regulations for this section to ensure no negative impact on Medicare trust funds.
